00046 fsal_status_t FSAL_opendir(
00047     fsal_handle_t             * p_dir_handle,           /* IN */
00048     fsal_op_context_t         * p_context,            /* IN */
00049     fsal_dir_t                * p_dir_descriptor,       /* OUT */
00050     fsal_attrib_list_t        * p_dir_attributes        /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00051 ){
00052   int rc, errsv;
00053   fsal_status_t status;
00054 
00055   fsal_path_t         fsalpath;
00056   struct stat         buffstat;
00057 
00058   /* sanity checks
00059    * note : dir_attributes is optionnal.
00060    */
00061   if (!p_dir_handle || !p_context || !p_dir_descriptor)
00062     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_opendir);
00063 
00064   /* get the path of the directory */
00065   status = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_dir_handle, 1, &fsalpath, &buffstat);
00066   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_opendir);
00067   
00068   /* Test access rights for this directory */
00069     
00070   status = fsal_internal_testAccess( p_context, FSAL_R_OK, &buffstat, NULL);
00071   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major,status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_opendir);
00072   
00073   /* if everything is OK, fills the dir_desc structure : */
00074   
00075   TakeTokenFSCall();
00076   p_dir_descriptor->p_dir = opendir(fsalpath.path);
00077   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00078   if ( !p_dir_descriptor->p_dir ) 
00079       Return(posix2fsal_error(errno) ,errno , INDEX_FSAL_opendir);
00080       
00081   memcpy( &(p_dir_descriptor->context) , p_context, sizeof(fsal_op_context_t));
00082   memcpy( &(p_dir_descriptor->path) , &fsalpath, sizeof(fsal_path_t));
00083   memcpy( &(p_dir_descriptor->handle) , p_dir_handle, sizeof(fsal_handle_t));
00084 
00085 #ifdef _USE_POSIXDB_READDIR_BLOCK
00086   p_dir_descriptor->p_dbentries = NULL;
00087   p_dir_descriptor->dbentries_count = 0;
00088   /* fill the p_dbentries list */
00089   statusdb = fsal_posixdb_getChildren( p_dir_descriptor->context.p_conn,
00090                                   &(p_dir_descriptor->handle),
00091                                   FSAL_POSIXDB_MAXREADDIRBLOCKSIZE,
00092                                   &(p_dir_descriptor->p_dbentries),
00093                                   &(p_dir_descriptor->dbentries_count)
00094   );
00095   if (FSAL_POSIXDB_IS_ERROR(statusdb)) /* too many entries in the directory, or another error */
00096     p_dir_descriptor->dbentries_count = -1;
00097 
00098 #endif
00099   if ( p_dir_attributes ) {
00100     
00101     TakeTokenFSCall();
00102     rc = lstat(fsalpath.path, &buffstat);
00103     errsv = errno;
00104     ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00105     if ( rc ) /* lstat failed */
00106       goto attr_err;
00107     
00108     status = posix2fsal_attributes(&buffstat, p_dir_attributes);
00109     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(status) ) {
00110 attr_err:
00111       FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( p_dir_attributes->asked_attributes );
00112       FSAL_SET_MASK( p_dir_attributes->asked_attributes,
00113           FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00114     }
00115   }
00116     
00117   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_opendir );
00118 
00119 }

00156 fsal_status_t FSAL_readdir(
00157     fsal_dir_t            * p_dir_descriptor,     /* IN */
00158     fsal_cookie_t         start_position ,      /* IN */
00159     fsal_attrib_mask_t    get_attr_mask,        /* IN */
00160     fsal_mdsize_t         buffersize,           /* IN */
00161     fsal_dirent_t         * p_pdirent,            /* OUT */
00162     fsal_cookie_t         * p_end_position,       /* OUT */
00163     fsal_count_t          * p_nb_entries,         /* OUT */
00164     fsal_boolean_t        * p_end_of_dir          /* OUT */
00165 ){
00166   fsal_status_t st;
00167   fsal_posixdb_status_t stdb;
00168   fsal_count_t  max_dir_entries;
00169   struct dirent *dp;
00170   struct dirent dpe;
00171   struct stat   buffstat;
00172   fsal_path_t   fsalpath;
00173   fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t infofs;
00174   int rc;
00175 
00176   /*****************/
00177   /* sanity checks */
00178   /*****************/
00179   
00180   if ( !p_dir_descriptor || !p_pdirent || !p_end_position
00181         || !p_nb_entries || !p_end_of_dir )
00182     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_readdir);
00183  
00184   max_dir_entries = (buffersize / sizeof(fsal_dirent_t));
00185 
00186   /***************************/
00187   /* seek into the directory */
00188   /***************************/
00189   errno = 0;
00190   if (start_position.cookie == 0) {
00191     rewinddir( p_dir_descriptor->p_dir );
00192     rc = errno;
00193   } else {
00194     seekdir( p_dir_descriptor->p_dir, start_position.cookie );
00195     rc = errno;
00196   }
00197   
00198   if ( rc ) {
00199     st.major = posix2fsal_error(rc);
00200     st.minor = rc;
00201     goto readdir_error;
00202   }
00203   
00204   /************************/
00205   /* browse the directory */
00206   /************************/
00207 
00208 *p_nb_entries = 0;
00209   while (*p_nb_entries < max_dir_entries)
00210   {
00211     /***********************/
00212     /* read the next entry */
00213     /***********************/
00214     TakeTokenFSCall();
00215     rc = readdir_r(p_dir_descriptor->p_dir, &dpe, &dp);
00216     ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00217     if ( rc ) {
00218       st.major = posix2fsal_error(errno);
00219       st.minor = errno;
00220       goto readdir_error;
00221     } /* End of directory */
00222     if (!dp) {
00223       *p_end_of_dir = 1;
00224       break;
00225     }
00226     
00227     /***********************************/
00228     /* Get information about the entry */
00229     /***********************************/
00230 
00231     /* build the full path of the file into "fsalpath */
00232     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_str2name(dp->d_name, FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN, &(p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries].name)))) 
00233       goto readdir_error;
00234     memcpy(&fsalpath, &(p_dir_descriptor->path), sizeof(fsal_path_t));
00235     st = fsal_internal_appendFSALNameToFSALPath(&fsalpath, &(p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries].name));
00236     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st))
00237       goto readdir_error;
00238     
00239     /* get object info */
00240     TakeTokenFSCall();
00241     rc = lstat(fsalpath.path, &buffstat);
00242     ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00243     if ( rc ) {
00244       st.major = posix2fsal_error(errno);
00245       st.minor = errno;
00246       goto readdir_error;
00247     }
00248     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( st = fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo(&buffstat, &infofs) ) )
00249       goto readdir_error;
00250 
00251     /********************/
00252     /* fills the handle */
00253     /********************/
00254 
00255     /* check for "." and ".." */
00256     if ( !strcmp(dp->d_name, ".") ) {
00257       memcpy( &(p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries].handle), &(p_dir_descriptor->handle), sizeof(fsal_handle_t) );
00258     } else if ( !strcmp(dp->d_name, "..") ) {
00259       stdb = fsal_posixdb_getParentDirHandle( p_dir_descriptor->context.p_conn,
00260                                               &(p_dir_descriptor->handle),
00261                                               &(p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries].handle)
00262                                             );
00263       if (FSAL_POSIXDB_IS_ERROR(stdb) && FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = posixdb2fsal_error(stdb))) 
00264         goto readdir_error;
00265     } else {
00266 #ifdef _USE_POSIXDB_READDIR_BLOCK
00267       if ( p_dir_descriptor->dbentries_count > -1 ) { /* look for the entry in dbentries */
00268         st = fsal_internal_getInfoFromChildrenList( &(p_dir_descriptor->context), 
00269                                                     &(p_dir_descriptor->handle), 
00270                                                     &(p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries].name), 
00271                                                     &infofs, 
00272                                                     p_dir_descriptor->p_dbentries,
00273                                                     p_dir_descriptor->dbentries_count,
00274                                                     &(p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries].handle));
00275       } else
00276 #endif
00277       { /* get handle for the entry */
00278         st = fsal_internal_getInfoFromName( &(p_dir_descriptor->context), 
00279                                             &(p_dir_descriptor->handle), 
00280                                             &(p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries].name), 
00281                                             &infofs, 
00282                                             &(p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries].handle));
00283       }
00284       if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st))
00285         goto readdir_error;
00286     } /* end of name check for "." and ".." */
00287 
00288     /************************
00289      * Fills the attributes *
00290      ************************/
00291     p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries].attributes.asked_attributes = get_attr_mask;
00292     st = posix2fsal_attributes( &buffstat, &(p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries].attributes) );
00293     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st))
00294       goto readdir_error;
00295 
00296     /*
00297      * 
00298      **/
00299     p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries].cookie.cookie = telldir(p_dir_descriptor->p_dir);
00300     p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries].nextentry = NULL;
00301     if (*p_nb_entries) 
00302       p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries - 1].nextentry = &(p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries]);
00303     
00304     (*p_end_position) = p_pdirent[*p_nb_entries].cookie;
00305     (*p_nb_entries) ++;
00306   };
00307   
00308   
00309   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_readdir );
00310 
00311   /* return error, and free what must be freed */
00312 readdir_error:
00313   Return(st.major, st.minor, INDEX_FSAL_readdir);
00314 }

00317 
00329 fsal_status_t FSAL_closedir(
00330     fsal_dir_t * p_dir_descriptor         /* IN */
00331 ){
00332   
00333   int rc;
00334   
00335   /* sanity checks */
00336   if ( !p_dir_descriptor )
00337     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_closedir);
00338   
00339   #ifdef _USE_POSIXDB_READDIR_BLOCK
00340     if (p_dir_descriptor->p_dbentries) Mem_Free(p_dir_descriptor->p_dbentries); 
00341   #endif
00342 
00343   rc = closedir( p_dir_descriptor->p_dir );
00344   if (rc != 0)
00345       Return(posix2fsal_error(errno) ,errno , INDEX_FSAL_closedir);
00346   
00347   /* fill dir_descriptor with zeros */
00348   memset( p_dir_descriptor , 0, sizeof(fsal_dir_t) );
00349     
00350   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_closedir );
00351   
00352 }
